Header.Title: Survivor Encyclopedia: Don't Starve Together Characters

Intro.Title: Welcome to Survivor Encyclopedia Don't Starve Together!
Intro.Desc: Welcome to our website dedicated to the characters of the game Don't starve together! Here you will find a detailed description of each hero, their unique features, strengths and weaknesses, and tips for use. We have collected useful information for you that help you choose the right character, master it and successfully survive in a dangerous world Don't Starve Together.

Update.Desc: Don't Starve Together update “Host of Horros” is already avaliable!

Footer.Title: Survivor Encyclopedia: Don't Starve Together Characters

Intro.Title: Characters
Intro.Desc: The game features 19 characters, some of which will be unlocked only after purchasing the DLC. In Don't Starve Together, all standard characters are immediately unlocked, as well as Wynonna and Walter. Wormwood, Vortox, Wurt and Wanda are unlocked for 2700 threads.

Footer.Title: Survivor Encyclopedia: Don't Starve Together Characters

Characters.Name: Wilson
Characters.Phrase: “I will conquer it all with the power of my MIND!”
Characters.Background: Late one evening, while working in his home laboratory, Wilson was stunned to hear a voice from the radio speaking directly to him. At first he was overcome by the fear that he had gone crazy from too many late experiments or from chemical fumes that he might accidentally inhale. But the voice assured that he was not just a figment of the imagination. Moreover, the voice voiced a proposal to the scientist: if Wilson builds a machine according to all the rules, then his reward will be forbidden knowledge that no one has ever seen before. Leaving all his sanity aside (what harm can suspicious transactions with mysterious disembodied voices do, after all?), Wilson immediately began creating the machine. When it was finally completed, the scientist began to have a bit of doubt... something that could have saved him from his impending fate if he had had a stronger will. But the voice insisted, and Wilson turned the lever, activating his creation... and it was never seen again.
Characters.Description: Wilson (full name - Wilson Percival Higgsbury) is the first and main character, a kind of calling card of the game Don't Starve. He is a fearless but rather arrogant gentleman scientist who is captured by Maxwell and taken to a mysterious wild world in which he must survive.

Pros: Wilson have a skill tree
Wilson one of the most balanced character
Cons: No cons
General: Wilson grows a beard that protects against freezing, but slows down cooling when overheated

Tips: Wilson is most comfortable building meat decoys because he doesn't have to hunt harebeards and rabbitbeards.
A beard is an excellent source of fuel.
Without any downsides, Wilson is equally effective in almost all situations.
Quotes: Normal: “Star-atoms! Are you my double?”
Attacker: “Oh my god. Do I always look this creepy?”
Assassin: “Your existence violates the laws of science, (player)!”
Resurrectionist: “(The player) is excellent at putting theories into practice.”
Ghost: “It`s better to concoct a means of resurrection. I can`t leave another scientist hanging.”
Pyro: “It wasn't very scientific to burn it, (player).”
Characters.Others: Wilson is just over 30 years old, as Klei wrote on their Facebook. According to some players, Wilson is wearing what appears to be a long-sleeved T-shirt or glove under his shirt; however, this is nothing more than speculation. According to official information, the black “sleeves“ are actually shading added for added contrast.Wilson may have a medical background. This is hinted at by his ability to revive allies faster in The Forge, the quote when examining the wooden leg, and his costume in The Gorge, where he is depicted as a doctor. Based on the quotes, Wilson seems to care a lot about his hair. Wilson had a nanny, as evidenced by his quote when examining Mumzy. Suffers from arachnophobia. His field notes exist in which he described his adventures in Persistence. A thick beard also protects against the cold: the stubble and beard are very weak, but a thick beard is a little better than a winter hat. Wilson's last name is Higgsbury, possibly a reference to the famous Higgs boson. Lefty; Possibly ambidextrous. Gentleman Scientist is a special social status that was assigned to a person with an academic degree who conducts independent research work. Research could be ordered - and, accordingly, financed - by the university to which the scientist belonged, or it could be a personal initiative and financed from personal funds; in such cases, the scientist usually had a private source of income (for example, dividends) and conducted research on topics of personal interest to him. The most famous gentlemen scientists are Thomas Jefferson, Antoine Lavoisier, Charles Darwin and others. Seven seconds into the “The Forbidden Knowledge“ video, a “GENIUS AT WORK“ sign can be seen nailed to the fence of Wilson's home. While being the ruler of Permanence, Wilson did not increase in size, although the other two rulers (Maxwell and Charlie) grew taller than other characters. This link provides access to Wilson's workshop, where Maxwell's door still stands. If you pull down the switch, the door will open and redirect you to a hidden page where you can see a message from Maxwell and concept art for the game. Team Fortress 2 featured a headdress based on Wilson's hairstyle. Before the August 7, 2012 update, Wilson had a different sprite. You can read Wilson's remarks here.

Characters.Name: Wormwood
Characters.Background: In one of the dimensions of Permanence with a wild jungle, a strange green gem fell from the “moon” (not to be confused with a green gem!), which gave life to a plant sprout. The newborn Wormwood is trying to figure out who he is. Butterfly? Maybe a bird? No, it doesn't look like it. Or maybe a dog? But no, he only scares all the little animals. A lonely Wormwood goes to sleep under the root of one of its inanimate relatives, after which flowers bloom on it, like on other plants.
Characters.Description: Wormwood is a character initially available in Don't Starve: Hamlet, as well as one of the paid characters in Don't Starve Together, but will be unlocked if the player has already purchased the Hamlet DLC.

Pros: Gifted gardener. Can plant seeds in the ground without using beds
Plants are relatives. Restores sanity by planting seeds, pine cones, sea roots, and dug up plants
Eyeflowers and angry bees are neutral to it
Loves fertilizers
Can talk to planted vegetables and fruits, learning at the same time what they need
Fire Nettle and Prickly Bindweed have no negative effects on Wormwood
During flowering, it gives plants care when it is nearby
Doesn't go crazy when wet
It can independently cause flowering in any season
Cons: Loses his mind due to cutting down and burning trees, picking flowers and digging up plants. This does not apply to trees that have already been burned
If characters or creatures near Wormwood negatively affect plants, Wormwood receives a negative aura to sanity

Like most plants, when in contact with an open flame, it can catch fire, which is why, in addition to damage from fire, it will also receive damage from burning. It may even catch fire from a strong fire or lightning strike. In the summer it may begin to smolder and then catch fire
Takes 25% more fire damage and burns longer than other characters
Seeds planted in bare soil will not grow into huge fruits
General: Has a special “Gift of Gardening“ tab
Food restores satiety, but does not affect health in any way - neither positively nor negatively
It blooms in the spring, which affects its movement speed and fasting rate. Details below

Tips: No matter how unpleasant it may be for Wormwood, logs are a very important resource for successful survival in the harsh world of Permanence, and in the world of the pig village, traffic jam is also important. Sanity also decreases when digging up stumps. At first, sanity for fallen brothers can be restored by studying recipes; later the rule “Cut down a tree, plant two” comes into play

Since planting grass restores 10 Sanity and digging up removes 5, you can restore your Sanity by planting and digging up one grass bush, sapling, or thorny bush. A good way to convert twigs and flint (or gold) into sanity

Sanity can also be restored by planting seeds - this increases it by only 5, i.e. weaker than when planting trees and bushes, but seeds are found in abundance, cost nothing and are added to 40 per cell - thanks to this, a cell with seeds serves as an excellent a means of compensation for any extreme decline in sanity - for example, when harvesting logs from trees that do not produce planting material, such as chestnut birches in winter or gnarled spruce trees

Due to the fact that sanity also drops when plants are destroyed by bosses, additional problems may unexpectedly arise when encountering a boss in a dense forest. Mass harvesting of logs by the pursuing boss, which is available to other characters, is a bad decision for Wormwood. Walking through the dense jungles of the Hamlet worlds is safer for Wormwood than for other characters. Of course, this is the place of his birth
Wormwood's toothy relatives can save him from periodic attacks by swarms of vampire bats. However, getting prey from the winged ones is problematic, since the tooth-eaters also want the carcass
It is much more convenient to create leafy meat farms from bait flowers, without the help of man-made turf

Pick up any seeds you find. More seeds means more potential food for Wormwood in the future without much effort. It is especially useful during the flowering season, spring or monsoon season. In addition, like plants in beds, plants grown by Wormwood on bare soil do not spoil in winter, which makes it possible to prepare them for the winter in this form

On the one hand, this is a very strong blow to the guts of the usual gameplay. A huge number of dishes from the cauldron lose their charm: where any other character can cancel the spider's damage by eating a frog sandwich, Wormwood will have to rely on other methods of treatment, for example, healing ointment
On the other hand, Wormwood can eat monster meat, monster lasagna and other junk food without harm to health (sanity is still reduced). In addition, raw red mushrooms can be eaten instead of carrots
Choose a base location close to the city of pigs, spider monkeys (Hamlet), beefalo, mouseliks (RoG), sneaky primates, water beefalo (SW) to constantly have access to dung
Thanks to Wormwood's immunity to allergies, you no longer have to worry about finding nettles, a gas mask, or a fan! You can spend this time on other things
Quotes: Normal: “Looking great, buddy!”
Attacker: “Why are you behaving badly, (player)?”
Assassin: “(Player), no! It is forbidden!”
Resurrectionist: “(Player) makes friends better!”
Ghost: “Oh. (player), is that you?”
Pyro: “Why make so much fire?!”
Characters.Others: You can find Wormwood's replicas here. Wormwood was added to the Hamlet DLC on February 7, 201Added to Don't Starve Together on June 6, 201Wormwood's voice is a didgeridoo. His name, Wormwood, translates to “wormwood“ in English. In the DLC, Hamlet has a unique font and phrase color. The font was transferred to DST, but the color became standard, because each player in the chat has its own random color. Appears surrounded by stones, instead of a balloon, which is more useful in terms of resources. Maxameleon also has a different dialogue with him. If any other creature starts a fire while Wormwood stands nearby, its sanity will also decrease. Has a special item creation animation when creating a living log. Special animations do not work if the character is in a boat. If the character has 20 health units left, you cannot kill yourself by creating a living log, since there will be one unit left. Dung, guano and a bucket of fertilizer restore two health points to Wormwood. If the fertilizer bucket is completely used in this way, you can get a total of 10 health units. Before Wormwood was officially released into the game, animations of Wormwood with a different design were found in the files.

Characters.Name: Maxwell
Characters.Background: The former king of the nightmare throne and also an egoist. Maxwell (who took his name from his former stage persona “The Incredible Maxwell“) was once the naive “William Carter“, a poor man from London who dreamed of becoming a world-famous magician. The moment fate handed William the Umbra Codex, he felt real power for the first time in his life. Having abandoned his old habits and fully embraced his new identity as a charismatic master of dark magic, Maxwell achieved fame and success, but it was not enough for him. As he delved deeper and deeper into his magical tome, studying its secrets, dark knowledge stupefied his mind and clouded his heart. In his final performance, Maxwell lost control of the black magic he had so brazenly used, and both he and his assistant Charlie were drawn into the Persistence. There he would remain for what seemed like an eternity, tied to a nightmare throne and forced to lure more and more victims into the Persistence trap. He's still haunted by the thought that someone he tricked into this world might find it in their hearts to set him free... and it irritates him greatly. He never liked being in debt.
Characters.Description: Maxwell (also known as ”The Demon” and William Carter) is the main antagonist in Don't Starve, appearing as a non-playable character. Subsequently, he can be unlocked as a playable character, and in Don't Starve Together he is initially such, in the mobile version the DLC is available immediately. Has unique abilities closely related to shadow magic.

Pros: He can create his own doubles, capable of doing various jobs and fighting for him
Can protect itself with shadow traps
Has access to the creation of a cabinet and a magician's top hat, which share the same inventory
Capable of restoring sanity without additional means (+6.7/min)
Does not cost Sanity when equipping Armor of Night, Darksaber, Dreadstone Armor, Dreadstone Helm, Void Robe, Void Hood, and Shadow Reaper
Cons: Physically weak: has only 75 health units.
General: Can use Wickerbottom books, but not create them.

Tips: Mage is the main role in Maxwell's priority. Starting the game with a Tome of Petrification, Maxwell must neutralize small groups of enemy warriors, turning them to stone. Pairs especially well with Wickerbottom in a team, allowing the use of 2 volumes of petrification. Once the Hellstaff drops, Maxwell can either wield it for the rest of the match, dealing significant damage with his duelists, or alternate it with the Summon Tome, setting up Golems for more firepower

The role of a healer is not the best choice for Maxwell, because... Maxwell does not have any advantages for healing, and shadow clones are summoned from the staff of life very rarely due to its low damage (before meeting mini-bosses, they may never be summoned at all due to the death of targets before causing a total damage of 300 units)
Due to his low health points, Maxwell should equip Greater Silk Armor in the mid-game, both to increase his maximum health and to allow his magic weapon's special abilities to recharge faster
In addition, clones disrupt attacks against small enemy units
Quotes: Normal: “What a neat guy!”
Attacker: “I'm familiar with this look, (player). What are you up to?”
Assassin: “Old habits need to be broken... just like you!”
Resurrectionist: “Just rely on yourself, huh, (player)?”
Ghost: “I must pay in blood to bring you back, (player).”
Pyro: “Don't blow it up on us, (player).”
Characters.Others: Maxwell was added as a playable character with the ”The End of the Beginning” update. And with the update ”All's Well that Maxwell” I received the Umbra Codex. Initially, in the guise of the antagonist, his head was supposed to be smaller. This texture and its animations are still in the game files. In very early versions, he was much older than he is represented in the game, he was hunchbacked and fat, and also wore a top hat. Despite the fact that Maxwell is only one of the three known rulers of Permanence (the other two are Charlie and Wilson), he can easily be considered the main antagonist of the franchise, because it was because of him and his games with dark magic that this whole story began. Maxwell's voice sounds like a harmonium. The proportions of the game character are noticeably different from the proportions of Maxwell, who appears at the start of the game. In Adventure mode, he is dressed differently than throughout the rest of the game. Maxwell was the first to mention Charlie. When he had phrases associated with her, no one yet knew what kind of character he was. Maxwell loves chess. Judging by the Wolfgang animation, he wore glasses for a while. As with Charlie, Maxwell's exact height is unknown. It varies in cinematics and from form to form in Adventure mode; it is especially worth noting the huge head of the antagonist hanging over Wilson's house in one of the cinematics. It is possible that Maxwell simply knows how to change his appearance, at least in the role of an antagonist. Unlike other characters, Maxwell differs significantly from himself in the cinematics and in the game, both in his villainous form and in his character form. Created his statues in the world. Klei created a very large puzzle for the players, as a result of which a story was revealed to everyone, which caused a lot of emotions. The complete solution to this puzzle is here. When Maxwell appears in the normal world, he says the line: “Freedom, at last!” (“Freedom, finally!”). You can use the console to summon his huge head, but judging by the character quotes, this is a mock-up. Using the console, you can summon Maxwell himself using the DebugSpawn(”maxwell”) command, and the model of Maxwell that appears when you start the game with any character except Maxwell himself will appear. The characters can examine it. In the game code it is written as Waxwell.

Characters.Name: Willow
Characters.Phrase: “Hmmm. I wonder if these will burn.”
Characters.Background: Willow came to Permanence in order to start everything from scratch - that`s what she always thought. This allowed her to leave a lot behind. From a young age, Willow seemed to do nothing but invite trouble. She was orphaned early and was forced to live in an orphanage with cruel teachers. And it soon turned out that at night she saw terrible creatures... creatures from which only her faithful teddy bear Bernie could protect her. But Bernie was taken away as punishment for what the teachers considered inappropriate behavior, and the shadows came for Willow. She had no choice but to stand up for herself. It was then that she learned: nothing could hold back the darkness like a roaring flame. And how nice it is to watch how all your troubles flare up one after another and immediately turn to ashes... This will not be the last time Willow burns everything down to start over.
Characters.Description: Willow is the first unlockable character and the first girl in the game. Judging by his remarks, he has a rather bad character. He loves fire very much and does not take damage from it. Willow can survive the night without outside light sources because she has a lighter. To open Willow, the player needs 160 experience points (8 in-game days, or 1 hour 4 minutes).

Pros: In your inventory from the very beginning of the game there is a lighter, similar in functionality to a torch. It differs from it in having a smaller lighting area. The lighter has durability and a recipe, and you can also use it to fry foods.

In addition to the lighter, there is an old Bernie Bear. Bernie can be equipped to restore sanity and keep warm at the expense of durability. When Willow's sanity is low, Bernie will grow large and attract horrors and hostile creatures to himself.
Immune to fire damage.
Burning objects, as well as structures such as campfires or fire pits, increase Sanity by up to +6.25/min if the fire is bright enough and Willow is close to it (the effect stacks).
Takes less damage from overheating and is less susceptible to overheating.
Lights a fire 1.5 times more efficiently than other characters.
Does not take damage when extinguishing objects, and also does it faster than other characters.
Cons: Loses sanity and takes more damage from freezing. She is more susceptible to both freezing and freezing (for example, from a cyclops deer or an ice staff), and warm clothes help her less than other characters.
Has few sanity units and therefore different insanity thresholds.
General: Both unique items can be used by other players (only Willow, Varley and Walter can cook food with a lighter, and Bernie becomes giant only when Willow herself becomes mad).
Loses and gains 10% more sanity from the influence of monster auras, clothing, etc.

Tips: Due to the fact that the lighter does not have infinite durability, it is recommended to wait out the night by setting trees on fire or starting a fire.
A very nice bonus is that you can fry food with a lighter: you can quickly cook meat without using an open fire.

Bernie is a full-fledged combat companion, capable of helping in the fight against numerous enemies, but is ineffective in battles with bosses. It is not recommended to use it all the time: firstly, you need to be in a state of madness, and without the proper equipment you can die, and secondly, to repair Bernie you need a sewing kit or the right ribbon, which are not very easy to get in the early stages of the game.
The downside to freezing does not play a special role if you heat the thermal stone in a timely manner and wear a beefalo hat. It is convenient to warm yourself by standing close to a burning tree.
Quotes: Normal: “Hey! This is my face, (player)! Give it back!”
Attacker: “You're making us look like idiots, (player)!”
Assassin: “Murderer! Burn the impostor!”
Resurrectionist: “Haha, not bad, (player).”
Ghost: “Is this what my ghost hair looks like?”
Pyro: “The Arsonist Twins! High five.”
Characters.Others: Willow was added to the game with an update on August 7, 2012. With the update, Strange New Powers received its own features and a unique item. While inspecting the tent, she says that she was a Girl Scout and earned all her badges. Willow is approximately 20 years old. Willow has a mental disorder called pyromania. It manifests itself in a painful attraction to arson. It is not known exactly whether Willow, when her sanity is low, sets fire to the ground with matches or whether this is a case of her displaying pyrokinesis - the ability to ignite objects with the power of thought. Willow's persona is likely based on Stephen King's novel Fire in the Eye. You can check out Willow's lines here. Older versions of the game did not have a lighter. Willow would set the ground beneath her on fire if she was in complete darkness for too long. The dragon fly (RoG icon) does not set Willow on fire with its attack, which makes the battle much easier. DLC: RoG: if you extinguish buildings with your hands, Willow will not receive damage, but will say that she was burned. When examining the red umbrella, he says: “I love this color!” She also says about all red things that they are beautiful, for example: a red mushroom - “Beautiful”, a red gem - “So beautiful!” Therefore, it can be assumed that red is Willow's favorite color. Probably because red is always associated with fire. Hates everything related to cold and ice, as well as the blue color associated with them, which can be understood when examining the blue gem: ”Ugh. It's terrible.” and an ice amulet: ”Ugh! This thing is not for me.” Willow, like all female playable characters (except Wickerbottom and Wynonna), lacks pupils. If you equip a lighter along with a cylinder, your sanity will not fall from the darkness even at night. In the cinematic, you can see Willow's lighter on a shelf in the closet. Her voice resembles a flute. The prototype for the dark skin is probably Wednesday Addams.

Characters.Name: Wendy
Characters.Background: Wendy's tale of grief begins with the untimely death of her dear sister Abigail. Wendy couldn't accept the idea that she would have to continue living without her sister. She turned to the occult in the hope that she would find some way to talk to those on the other side. In the end, after much trial and error, when the candles from the seances were burned to the ground, and all the Ouija boards were thrown out in a fit of anger, the girl was almost ready to give up and fall into despair... until, finally, a sign appeared. The ragtime tune might seem like a very strange message from the other world, but Wendy was ready to grab anything to get closer to her sister. And of course, soon the voice will tell her what to do...
Characters.Description: Wendy is a girl with a very macabre outlook on life. Everything that happens around her connects with death, even herself. To open Wendy, you need 640 experience points (32 game days, or 4 hours 16 minutes).

Pros: Starts the game with the Abigail Flower, which summons the ghost of her deceased twin sister Abigail.
Loses only 75% of sanity from monsters and darkness.
Doesn't lose his mind near ghosts.
Does not lose sanity if there is a ghost of another player in the world in the ”Survival” server mode.
Restores 15 sanity when summoning Abigail.
Can enhance Abigail with elixirs from her creation filter.
Can create a sister urn in its filter. The building restores 25 Sanity per minute and doubles Abigail's next level when filled with petals.
Cons: Deals 25% less damage than other characters.
Loses 30 sanity when Abigail dies.
General: Sistra's Wraith deals splash damage.

Tips: Summon your sister from the very beginning of the game so that by the third day she can deal more damage.
Attack groups of enemies (bees, spiders, etc.), due to the high damage and protection of the sister, this will be an easy farm.
Quotes: Normal: “She looks sad...”
Attacker: “Wait, that's not necessary, (player).”
Assassin: “Haven't we seen enough death, (player)?”
Resurrectionist: “I hope Abigail doesn't like you more than me...”
Ghost: “At least the heart will bring one sister back to this world...”
Pyro: “Fire is probably not the method I would choose...”
Characters.Others: Wendy was added to the game with an unnamed update on August 7, 2012. Before the Strange New Powers update, Abigail would come to Wendy for no reason at night and could even cause damage to her. DST received a character update on March 19, 2020. Before him, Wendy had the same features as in Don't Starve. According to the developers, Wendy's age is from 8 to 10 years. Wendy loves to read, as evidenced by her quotes with references to various literary works. Judging by Wendy's remarks about the musical instruments available in the game, she is interested in music. It is possible that Wendy likes sweet potatoes, as hinted at by the girl's line in the Shipwrecked DLC, which is one of her few optimistic lines about herself. However, this may be a hint that Wendy will be sweet for the monsters. Wendy loves Abigail very much. Wendy and Abigail are the daughters of Jack Carter, brother of William Carter, known as Maxwell. However, what is noteworthy is that they do not react to Maxwell, as an uncle, in any way, either in a single game, or in DST, or even in cinematics. Moreover, Maxwell also does not see his relatives in them. The assumption that Wendy and Abigail are Maxwell`s relatives appeared long before the official confirmation of this fact by the developers. In her DST ghost form, the flower on her head turns yellow to differentiate her from Abigail. Judging by some of the lines, Wendy and Webber have a friendly relationship. The concept (just like science) of “ectoherbology” does not exist in the real world. It is formed by crossing the ancient Greek word “ἐϰτός“ (external) and the English word “herbology“ (herbology/herbology). What this science studies is currently unknown, but based on the words that form its name, it can be assumed that it implies a connection with the “outer world” (the world of the dead) through plants. Actually, this is how it looks in the game. A similar trend existed in alchemy, but not in occultism. What is noteworthy is that Wendy was interested in the latter, but not the first.

Characters.Name: WX-78
Characters.Background:
[SYNTAX_ERROR_LOG]
The WX-78 was the result of an incredible experiment led by {[Loading Compassion Module Library()]} and Robert Wagstaff. The experiment turned out to be a [STUNDERING SUCCESS], but Wagstaff, [A SMALL FOOL FEARING PROGRESS], decided to stop further research. Adamantly believing that the process of its creation could still be improved, WX refused to give up and continued his experiments in secret. When Wagstaff finally found out what he was doing, a heated argument broke out, but 1111 00100000 01101100 01100001 01110100 01100101 00100000 01110100 01101111 01101111 00100000 01101100 01100001 01110100 011 00101
Characters.Description: WX-78 is the fifth (fourth unlockable) character in the game. A robot that despises all biological life forms with rare exceptions. Has the lowest stats of any character (with the exception of DST), but can increase them significantly.

Pros: In DST, a character can also eat spoiled food without penalties to the food's stats.
It has a unique energy scale into which it can insert various circuits to obtain boosts.
Can eat gears to gain 60 health, 75 satiety, and 50 sanity, although cannot improve their maximum stats with them, unlike the single-player version of the game.
Mechanical chess is more neutral to the WX-78, the radius of approaching it without subsequent aggression is significantly reduced.
Cons: If the humidity parameter rises above 15, it begins to lose 1 unit of charge every five seconds and receive from 3.3 to 9 units of damage every five seconds, depending on the degree of wetness.
Starts the game with lower stats than most characters, but can improve them with schematics.
General: Can use lightning rods, generators, Winona D.R.A.G. generators, electric milk and Volt-goat chauffeur to generate energy.
Receives a certain amount of eaten gears back after changing characters or dying.

Tips: WX-78 attracts lightning to itself like a lightning rod, however, the latter has higher priority - if it is within the range of a structure, lightning will strike it and not the character.

The following ways to get a system overload are also available: activate the altar, use the telelocation staff, hit the ancient pseudoscientific station with a hammer, be within the radius of the husky whirlwind, approach the thunderbird.
Quotes: Normal: “GREETINGS, (player). YOU LOOK SMARTER THAN OTHERS”
Attacker: “MY EXECUTABLES ARE READY TO RUN, (player)”
Assassin: “TIME TO ELIMINATE THE VIRUS (player).”
Resurrectionist: “(Player), OF COURSE, OUR MOST VALUABLE ASSET”
Ghost: “SUBJECT (player) NEEDS A HEART”
Pyro: “MY FAVORITE SETTING. BURNING”
Characters.Others: The WX-78 was added to the game with the Spoiled Rotten update. With the update, “Strange New Powers“ received more of its own features. The name WX-78 is likely a reference to the RX-78 series mobile suits from the anime Mobile Suit Gundam. The most notable is the RX-78-2 from the same series. You can check out the WX-78 replicas here. WX-78 has a quote about the strange potato: “REMINDS ME OF MY MOTHER“, which may be a reference to GLaDOS from the Portal series. In the Reign of Giants DLC, when the humidity is high, the player loses 0.5 sanity per second. In DST, when the PvP server mode is enabled, WX does not receive additional damage from electric weapons. Judging by his lines, the few living things he doesn't despise are bees, thunderbirds, and worker pigs: when examining the former, he says, “THE MINDLESS DRONE. I LIKE IT,“ and the latter, “FINALLY! A USEFUL BIOLOGICAL UNIT!“ , and third - “WORKER. NOBLE PROFESSION.“ Charged Volt-Goat and Jellyfish do not charge the WX-78 when they are shocked. His ghost resembles the droid R2-D2 from the Star Wars movie. The duration of the lightning buffs is cumulative and can last for several days, however it is advisable to keep a torch in your pocket to be prepared for the end of these powers at night, otherwise you will be killed by Charlie. If WX-78 moves between world levels, it will lose its speed bonus and glow. In Don't Starve Together, if WX-78 dies near Vortox, he will not lose his soul, unlike other characters. For some reason, he doesn't even like Lucy, although in the game she is not an organic life form. Upon examining her, he says, “TAKE IT OUT.“ From the animation and some details you can understand that the WX-78 is the creation of Robert Wagstaff: Its name is similar to the name of one of the Voxol radio models - PR-76. The radio can be seen on the search rod. When inspecting the ship's horse, Wagstaff says: “Incredible! Even I couldn't make my car waterproof.“ This may be a reference to the WX-78's weakness to water. When Wagstaff examines WX-78 sitting on the nightmare throne, he recognizes it. (“This is...? It can't be!“) Both Wagstaff and WX-78 have similar cues when examining a bud. (Wagstaff: “My Favorite Portable Fibonacci Counter“ and WX-78: “PORTABLE FIBONACCI COUNTER“) WX-78 and Wagstaff are the only characters able to understand what part the broken AAK device is missing, namely DR356X001. (Wagstaff: “Oh. It's missing DR356X001“ and WX-78: “OF COURSE IT'S BROKEN, IT'S MISSING DR356X001“) Based on the grainy broadcast cue, WX-78 recognizes Wagstaff (“YOU“). Based on the new information in the video dedicated to the WX-78 update, you can understand the following: Inside WX-78 is the consciousness of an unknown scientist, copied or transferred into the robot's mechanical body by Wagstaff during an experiment. There was a conflict between the WX-78 and Wagstaff, as WX wanted to continue producing similar machines. Wagstaff destroyed his designs and sent WX-78 itself to Permanence. Wilson's line when examining the WX-78 killer refers to the first law of robotics[6]. In early versions of Don't Starve Together, the hunger, sanity, and health caps were capped at 200. All WX-78 phrases are written in capital letters. If you write a chat message in Don't Starve Together, it will also appear above the robot in all capital letters.

Characters.Name: Woodie
Characters.Phrase: “Lucy would want me to chop it down.”
Characters.Background: Woody is a modest but terribly mysterious man, originally from the Great White North, where the mountains are completely covered with pine trees. The woodcutter keeps the past to himself, with his vest (or, in his case, his flannel). He is never seen without his signature bushy beard or Lucy's trusty axe, which is a mystery in itself. The remaining survivors cannot say for sure: either Woody simply moved, or something lives in an inanimate-looking object. Sometimes they swear that they hear a cheerful woman's voice talking to Woody when no one is around... As the moon's power increased, so did the effects of Woody's curse. He soon discovered that he could transform not only into a beaver, but also into an elk, and even into a goose. When his transformations became harder to predict, Woody decided to find a way to better control his curse. Using all the knowledge he had gained during his time at Permanence (and some additional advice from Wickerbottom), he soon discovered that his transformations could indeed be controlled. And now, by creating idols and consuming them when he wanted to convert, Woody feels more comfortable in his own skin than before.
Characters.Description: Woodie is the seventh (sixth unlockable) character, representing the image of a typical lumberjack: a thick beard and mustache, a flannel plaid shirt and pants with suspenders.

Pros: He has a talking ax named Lucy, which has no durability and cuts down trees 2 times stronger and faster than usual.
Can create special idols for transformation.
Tames pigs, hares and rock lobsters for longer than other characters.
Cons: Inventory, collecting, crafting and using items are not available when transformed.
If Woody dies in werewolf form, he will also die in his normal state, similar to Wilba.
Decrease in sanity at a rate of 6 units/min when transformed.
General: The chance to summon a Treant is 50% higher than other characters (that is, approximately 2%).
The beard provides 45 insulation (same as Wilson's beard stage 2), but cannot be shaved.
Transforms into a beaver, elk, or goose on a full moon, when eating two pieces of monster meat (random werewolf), or when eating one of the idols (werewolf corresponding to the idol).
Tree Hunger has been removed and replaced with Weremeter, which only appears in Werewolf form. Accordingly, you can no longer eat vegetation.

Tips: Despite his lines, Woody is a natural runner. Lucy's throws instantly provoke the warriors' aggression towards Woody, which allows him to keep the attention of dangerous enemies on himself even better than Ves. A feather wreath and a reed tunic with a feather allow Woody to be practically inaccessible to the attacks of Pugna's retinue, even to Pig.

In the early waves, when there are few dangerous warriors, it can play the role of a good tank due to the increased attack speed of its axe. It is also recommended to take this role in battle with the most dangerous warrior.
Quotes: Normal: “(Player)! It's funny to see another Canadian here.”
Attacker: “(Player) is not a real Canadian...”
Assassin: “Hey, come here, (player)! Here one question came to the fore!”
Resurrectionist: “You truly have a heart as big as your beard, (player).”
Ghost: “Canadians should help each other, (player). Let's get the heart.”
Pyro: “Now this fire seems to be harmful, huh?”
Characters.Others: Woody was added to the game with the Strange New Powers update. Received a character update in DST on September 12, 2019. Before him, wood hunger was an additional parameter that fell over time or intensely when trees were cut down. Upon reaching 25 units of wood hunger, Woody turned into a beaver. Woody's voice is cello; Lucy is a musical saw. The phrase “I love Lucy!“ may be a reference to the series of the same name. If, after turning the beaver back into Woody, you go into the dungeon and exit, Lucy will appear in your inventory. When passing through Maxwell's portal, Lucy is added to the inventory again. Woody's lines can be found here. Judging by his remarks, he suffers from ornithophobia (fear of birds). Judging by the remark about the web, he may suffer from arachnophobia (fear of spiders). Canadian by birth. The reaction to a filled chest is “It`s already packed worse than a tram in Toronto” and to an open sinkhole – “It`s like what`s in your Sudbury down there.” Woody may have worked in railroad construction in the past, because when he looks at the saltpeter, he says, “This is how we build railroads.” Also, judging by the remarks, he suffers from an allergy to grass. Refuses to shave his beard. He comments on this by saying that real woodcutters do not shave. Woody can't swim. This may explain the inability to swim as a beaver (SW). During the battle, Woody shouts the phrase: “Get over here, eh!“ This may be a reference to Scorpion's famous line from the Mortal Kombat series. Pigs left without a home run after Woody Beaver at night, saying: “Fire is good,” etc. This can be explained by the beaver`s night vision. When inspecting the manure, Woody says “Don't mess with camp!“, which most likely means he was a camp counselor. In any werewolf form, Woody can use the dance emote. The werepig will not attack Woody if he is in werewolf form during a full moon (DST).

Characters.Name: Wickerbottom
Characters.Background: When people meet Miss Wickerbottom, most people assume that they have a good idea of who they are looking at. She looks like the typical librarian she calls herself. Being at home, among the bookshelves, she feels as if she is in her natural habitat. No one would even be surprised to learn that such a person is well versed in a wide range of issues. But might he think that her knowledge rivals that of the experts? And, obviously, it would never even occur to anyone to wonder what a librarian could be doing during non-working hours, when the library doors are closed from prying eyes...
Characters.Description: Wickerbottom is the sixth (fifth unlockable) character. She is a textbook image of a librarian: gray hair gathered in a bun, a book, glasses.

Pros: Wickerbottom's knowledge is one level higher than that of other characters, so she initially has access to recipes that are unlocked on the scientific machine, and when building it, recipes for the alchemy engine are unlocked.
It has its own building - a bookcase.
Can create and read various books.
Cons: When eating rotten food (yellow background), he receives less satiety and does not restore health at all.
Cannot eat rotten food (red background).
Reading books wastes your mind.
General: Cannot sleep, including from gestalts, flutes and the yawn of a badger bear.

Tips: Due to his spell enhancements, Wickerbottom is a better healer than other characters.

Copes well with the role of a magician; in the battle with the Hog Warrior after he summons grunts from the inferno, an enhanced meteor can kill minions in one shot if there are no battle banners of defense on the battlefield.

A fairly common tactic after the 3rd wave is to install a bloom of life, and then, when all the boars reach it and fall asleep, wall them up in stone. The main thing is that some player with a Crucible hammer does not hit the anvil.
Quotes: Normal: “Ah, greetings, (player)! It's funny to see you here.”
Attacker: “(Player)'s immorality is creating holes in my hypotheses about multiverses.”
Assassin: “I'm my own worst critic!”
Resurrectionist: “Our knowledge helped us, right,(player)?”
Ghost: “Our self-help books are finally going to come in handy, huh, (player)?”
Pyro: “Burning books is quite tactless, (player).”
Characters.Others: Wickerbottom was added to the game with the Progress! update. With the update, “Strange New Powers“ received its own features and a “Books“ tab. Before this update, she could create prototypes of a shadow manipulator when she was next to an alchemical machine. At the beginning of the game, Wickerbottom has 2 units of papyrus in her inventory, which can be spent on creating a book or, for example, a birdcage. Has the highest level of intelligence among the characters (except for the fully gear-improved WX-78 and Warbucks in its early versions). The voice sounds like an oboe. Often names the names of plants and animals (also bone eyes and wormholes) in Latin. You can see Wickerbottom's remarks here. The only female character to have eye pupils, with the exception of Wynonna. Judging by the lines, Wickerbottom loves owls and fish dishes. Her eyes are always covered with eyelids, they can only be seen open during the start of the game, and when Wickerbottom is sleeping, fishing, or looking around in fear when her sanity is low. When lightning strikes her, you can see bones in her skirt and hair. The rest of the characters also have book reading animations in the game files. Her snowfall skin may be a reference to the Snow Queen from the fairy tale of the same name or to the White Witch from the book “The Chronicles of Narnia“. Wendy's line about the Wickerbottom Murderer (“Murder, she wrote“) is a reference to the popular American detective television series. Wigfrid's phrase about the ghost of Wickerbottom (Heart! Heart! My camp for the heart!) is a reference to William Shakespeare's tragedy “King Richard III“ (A horse, a horse, half a kingdom for a horse!).
